Game Libraries Class

Building a Basic Game Engine

Information

The purpose of the Game Libraries class was to learn about game engines and work on building our own simple game engine. We started basically from scratch and built everything from the ground up following an entity-component based system.

This is a screenshot from the engine rendering several hundred cubes at varying rotational speeds, rotating angles, and sizes.

The graphics library we used was OpenGL. We only used simple shaders for this because our next class would go more in depth on shaders.
